Regarding put options, what would you like to know?  GCT options are traded monthly, and the expiration of options is every third Friday of the month. If you buy a put at a certain strike price, you have the right to sell the stock at the strike price to who sold you the put. However, if you sell a put, the one who bought it has the right to sell the stock to you at the strike price. Generally, such actions are taken on the day of option expiration, and it can be done up to either 5:00 or 6:00 PM on the day of expiration (note, this is 1 or 2 hours after the market closes). 

People buy puts for two reasons.  First, if they believe the stock will go down and if so, they will make money. They don‚Äôt have to put up too much money for it. Therefore, the percent return can be significantly higher than from stock sale/purchase. They can close the position whenever they wish. Second, as a hedge for the stocks they own. People also can sell a put, if they wish to buy a stock only at a certain price below the actual stock price. If the stock goes below the strike price, they will end up buying the stock at the strike price. If the stock remains above the strike price, they will pocket the premium they received when they sold the put.
